channel.title: Please someone explain me login process
channel.description:
I need a server source that only logs in and out so I could study from it. Or could someone tell me what is the first packet? What does it send? Okay just my image of that stuff..
server starts server accepts client <Does the client send anything else before the unsigned byte below a row?> client sends a packet "unsigned byte" that is 1 byte long(in c++ it would be a 1 bytes long char) server uses readunsignedbyte() to read it and this packet returns 14(the login code)
Did I understand it so far? Well the prob is that every time the first packet has a random byte value.. And I don't know what to do with it(and how long it is, what declaration or encrytion etc it is using)...

item.title: Please someone explain me login process
item.dc:creator: @West7man West7man
item.description:
@West7man wrote:

I need a server source that only logs in and out so I could study from it.
Or could someone tell me what is the first packet? What does it send?
Okay just my image of that stuff…

server starts
server accepts client
<Does the client send anything else before the unsigned byte below a row?>
client sends a packet “unsigned byte” that is 1 byte long(in c++ it would be a 1 bytes long char)
server uses readunsignedbyte() to read it and this packet returns 14(the login code)

Did I understand it so far?
Well the prob is that every time the first packet has a random byte value… And I don’t know what to do with it(and how long it is, what declaration or encrytion etc it is using)…

Read full topic
item.source: Please someone explain me login process
